root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected to show only in test mode (isTest()) but script contains no test-mode check.
Validation logic is inverted: the code uses ~any(...,1,2,97,98,99) which selects values NOT equal to 1,2,97,98,99 (i.e. invalid values) instead of selecting valid codes.
Special-code handling incorrect: 97/98/99 are included inside the any() that is negated, producing an incorrect acceptance/rejection logic for these special values.
instructions: Add the test-mode entry condition so the selection only runs for test respondents. For example combine isTest() with the selection: sel if ( isTest() and ( ... ) ).

Fix the validation so you select respondents who provided a valid answer (codes 1 or 2). Replace the current sel if expression with logic that checks for valid codes, e.g.: sel if ( isTest() and ( (~miss(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1) and any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_1,1,2)) or (~miss(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2) and any(HidScn4Bn4COrder_2,1,2)) ) ).
If special codes 97/98/99 should be treated as invalid, you do not need to include them in any(...). If they should be explicitly excluded, add an explicit exclusion, e.g. and ~any(var,97,98,99).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected isTest() (show only in test mode) but script has no test-mode check.
Validation logic inverted: the script uses ~any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,1,2,97,98,99) selecting values that are NOT 1,2,97,98,99 (i.e. invalid values) instead of selecting valid codes (1 or 2).
Special-code handling incorrect: 97/98/99 are included in the negated any(), causing incorrect treatment of those codes.
instructions: Add the test-mode filter: include isTest() in the selection, e.g. sel if ( isTest() and ... ).
Change the validation to select valid answer codes. For a single-choice variable use: sel if ( isTest() and ~miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1) and any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,1,2) ).
If 97/98/99 should be treated as invalid/missing, do not include them in the any() valid-code list; if they must be explicitly excluded, add and ~any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder1,97,98,99).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected isTest() not present in script.
Validation is inverted: uses ~any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,1,2,97,98,99) which selects records that are NOT 1,2,97,98,99 (invalid values) instead of selecting valid codes 1 or 2.
Incorrect handling of special codes 97/98/99 due to their inclusion in the negated any().
instructions: Include the test-mode condition (isTest()) in the selection, for example: sel if ( isTest() and ... ).
Replace the inverted validation with a direct check for valid codes. Example: sel if ( isTest() and ~miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2) and any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,1,2) ).
If special codes 97/98/99 should be excluded, either omit them from the valid-code list or explicitly exclude them with and ~any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder2,97,98,99).

root_causes: Missing entry condition: expected to run only in test mode (isTest()) but no test-mode check is present.

Validation logic inverted for subquestions: uses ~any(...,1,2,97,98,99) for each subquestion which selects values NOT equal to those codes (i.e. invalid responses) instead of selecting valid codes (1 or 2).
Special-code handling incorrect: inclusion of 97/98/99 inside the negated any() leads to wrong acceptance/exclusion of those special codes.
instructions: Add the test-mode entry condition so the script runs only for test respondents, e.g. sel if ( isTest() and ( ... ) ).

Correct the subquestion validation to check for valid answer codes. For example: sel if ( isTest() and ( (~miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1) and any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_1,1,2)) or (~miss(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2) and any(HidScn5Dn5EOrder_2,1,2)) ) ).
Handle special codes properly: if 97/98/99 represent don't know/refuse and should be excluded, do not include them in the valid any(...) list, or explicitly exclude them with and ~any(var,97,98,99).
